name: Calgary Folk Fest
description: A website for a local music festival with well over 40 years of rich history in the heart of downtown Calgary, AB.

content.concept: Calgary Folk Fest is a local music festival that has been running for over 40 years. They  needed a digital refresh to match its cultural significance. Their outdated website contained extensive content that required re-imagining.
content.solution: As part of a small team, we built them a brand new solution from the ground up with Next.js, StrapiCMS and MySQL - hosted on AWS. on top of developing the frontend, I was also largely responsible for architecture and infrastructure.

name: OurRecipes
description: A Simple tool to parse the recipe from websites without all the extra stuff. Designed to be used primarily on mobile devices.

content.concept: Recipe websites are loaded with unnecessary stories, tons of advertisements and sometimes jump the page when they refresh, causing you to lose your place on the page. I wanted to use this medium to explore web scraping with JavaScript to parse only the recipe information
content.solution: I wanted to create a simple solution to parse the recipe from the website to cut out all of the noise, so we could focus on making the recipe.

name: Tedana App
description: A desktop application for Tedana - a program for multi-echo fMRI processing using Tauri, Rust and React.

content.concept: Multi-echo fMRI is a new concept in the world of neuroscience. It is not very well understood and not yet integrated into current data processing pipelines.
content.solution: I sought to create a tool to make it easier to use Tedana, and used this as a medium to learn Tauri, a new framework for building modern desktop applications.

name: Resume Builder
description: A tool I used to create my resume using LaTeX and Next.js

content.concept: Resume templates via word or other sources like canva are often bloated, difficult to modify, and don't work well with ATS parsing.
content.solution: I decided to learn how to work with LateX using a clean resume format so that I could customize exactly the way I wanted, and I could be confident in its parsability. I then took it another step further and created a simple custom CMS to integrate with it.
